Course Description: IN THIS COURSE IN BUSINESS ADMINISTRATION STUDENTS LEARN TO RECORD THE OPERATIONS CARRIED OUT BY THE ECONOMIC UNIT IN TERMS OF ITS CAPITAL, AND THE RESULTS OBTAINED BY SAID UNIT, DEMONSTRATED BY MEANS OF DIFFERENT ACCOUNT STATEMENTS THAT PROVIDE THE POSSIBILITY OF EVALUATING THE ADMINISTRATION OF THE BUSINESS BY MEANS OF GENERALLY ACCEPTED ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES AND LEGAL PROVISIONS.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
RECORD THE COMMERCIAL TRANSACTIONS OF A COMPANY.
QUANTIFY THE RESULTS OF THE MANAGEMENT OF A BUSINESS.
FORMULATE THE PROFIT AND LOSS STATEMENTS AND THE BALANCE SHEET OF A NON-MANUFACTURING BUSINESS.
Textbook(s):
ACCOUNTING
AUTHOR: WARREN, CARL S. / REEVE, JAMES M. / DUCHAC, JONATHAN (2012)
